head.title: New Job for Esiason On Monday Night

hedline.hl1: New Job for Esiason On Monday Night

abstract.p: Boomer Esiason returns to Monday night football, signing a two-year deal with CBS Radio Sports (S)

block.p: Boomer Esiason returned to Monday night football yesterday, signing a two-year deal with CBS Radio Sports four months after being dropped from ABC's telecast.
At CBS Radio, he will be teamed with Matt Millen and Howard David.
Boomer Esiason returned to Monday night football yesterday, signing a two-year deal with CBS Radio Sports four months after being dropped from ABC's telecast.
At CBS Radio, he will be teamed with Matt Millen and Howard David.

Esiason said he did not believe his career as a football analyst was doomed after ABC fired him and he harshly criticized Al Michaels, his former partner, because he was solicited for the radio job shortly after his dismissal.
''I thought he did a darn good job on ABC,'' said Joel Hollander, the president of CBS Radio Sports/Westwood One, who signed Esiason and expects him to help the broadcast acquire new sponsors.
Esiason said he expects to act ''professionally'' each Monday night when he sees Michaels.

''I can't worry about what's transpired,'' Esiason said. ''I'll be doing the Super Bowl, a conference championship game and I won't have to do any preseason. So I'm not worried about what's happened in the past.''
